noun.description: A Latin American or Spanish stew or thick soup typically made with meat and vegetables or pulses.

origin: Late 18th century (in an earlier sense). In some forms from Spanish puchero from classical Latin pultārius kind of cooking pot (from pult-, puls + -ārius; compare Spanish (plural) puches). In some forms from Spanish puchera, probably alteration (with suffix substitution: compare -era) of puchero; compare caldero and caldera, both cauldron.
